title: Why is it so hard for me to describe myself in a paragraph? - Quora

response.answer_text: The question was - Why is it so hard for me to describe myself in a paragraph? There are two reasons. First, you know yourself really well and want to do a full description. It’s hard to cut out some things that might be objectively less important because ‘you’re not objective.’ The second reason is the human condition - we (and you) don’t want to be wrong. What you write will have errors or not be perfect. It’s hard to do that. Thanks for the A2A.

Because you are over-thinking it. Make a list of relevant things about yourself in relation to whatever the bio is for, then condense them into short, easy-to-read sentences. Cut out any adverbs (change the verb if you need to, to make it stronger), and then go. “I’m only 21. I really have no routine,” doesn’t matter. And being negative about who you are, and what you are trying to accomplish makes me wonder why you are making a bio in the first place. Figure out the purpose of the bio, and you should be able to list things about yourself that are relevant. Think of it as a miniature resume.
